paper_abstract: We describe a class of adaptive algorithms tor approximating the global minimum of a function defined on a compact subset of R(d) The algorithms are adaptive versions of Monte Carlo search and use a memory of a fixed number of past observations By choosing a large enough memory. the convergence rate can be made to exceed any power of the convergence rate obtained with standard Monte Carlo search (C) 2008 IMACS Published by Elsevier B V All rights reserved
paper_title: Randomized algorithm for global optimization with bounded memory
